locomotion.config.yacl_not_found.descrip: Locomotion uses the configuration library "YetAnotherConfigLib" to generate the in-game configuration screen. It is not a required dependency, but it must be installed if you would like to adjust the configuration while in-game. Otherwise you may modify the configuration manually in .minecraft/config/locomotion.json
locomotion.config.title: Locomotion Configuration
locomotion.config.category.general.name: General
locomotion.config.category.first_person_: Settings for first person player animations
locomotion.config.option.enable_first_pe: Whether Locomotion's first person player animations should be used or not. Unlike most other animations provided, this one has its own separate renderer that completely overwrites Vanilla's first person renderer. Disable this to show Vanilla's first person player renderer, or for compatibility with mods that integrate into Vanilla's first person renderer.
locomotion.config.group.first_person_cam: Settings for adjusting how intense the camera shake animations are.
locomotion.config.option.first_person_ca: Controls the intensity of all camera shake animations.
Controls the intensity of camera shaking from the movement animations, including view bobbing.
Controls the intensity of camera shaking from the item interaction animations, including attacking and mining.
locomotion.config.group.first_person_arm: Settings for adjusting how the arms are rotated when the camera is moved around.
locomotion.config.option.enable_first_pe: Whether the first person arm dampening is enabled or not. Disabling this makes the arms not move at all when moving the camera.
locomotion.config.option.first_person_ar: Controls how much friction the spring animation has. The higher the damping, the less it bounces back and forth
Controls how quickly the arms rotate to match up with the camera's rotation
locomotion.config.option.first_person_mi: Adjusts how fast the mining animations play. 1 is normal speed, 0.5 is half as fast, and 2 is twice as fast
locomotion.config.option.running_arm_swi: Adjusts much the arms will swing during running animations. With a value of 0, the animation will be the same as the walking animation. With a value of 1, the full arm swing animation will play instead of the walking animation
locomotion.config.group.first_person_map: Settings for how map items are displayed and animated.
locomotion.config.option.first_person_ma: Controls the intensity of movement animations when holding a map item. A lower intensity helps with map readability.
locomotion.config.group.first_person_arm: Settings for adjusting the position of the first person arms
locomotion.config.option.first_person_ar: Arm offset on the X (horizontal) axis
Arm offset on the Y (vertical) axis
Arm offset on the Z (depth) axis
locomotion.config.category.block_entitie: Settings for various block entity animations
locomotion.config.group.individual_block: Toggles for each type of block entity
locomotion.config.group.block_entity_opt: Settings for block entity animations that affect performance.
locomotion.config.option.block_entity_po: How often block entity animations' poses are evaluated. For once per tick, the animation is calculated once every in-game tick and then linearly interpolated. For every frame, the pose is calculated every frame and not interpolated. Once per tick should generally be more optimized, but with 20FPS interpolated animations.
locomotion.config.option.block_entity_an: How far away from the player animations are played. Outside the range, vanilla animations play instead.
